questions.body:
*[1/15]*
Have you ever developed a budget?

1) Yes, I have
2) No, I have not

*[2/15]*
Do you currently know your monthly basic or net income?

1) I know my exact monthly income
2) I have an idea of my monthly income
3) I don't really know my monthly income
4) My income changes from month to month

*[3/15]*
Do you currently track your monthly expenses?

1) Yes, I track my monthly expenses closely
2) I have an idea of my monthly expenses
3) No

*[3b/15]*
If not, why have you not been drawing up a budget and tracking your monthly income and expenses?

1) I do not have enough money to draw up a budget
2) The WageWise budget template is not easy to use
3) Budgeting takes up too much time
4) I don’t like to track my income and expenses

*[4/15]*
Have you been saving on a monthly basis?

1) I save a portion of my income on a monthly basis
2) I save a portion of my income when I can
3) I have not been saving any of my income on a monthly basis

*[4b/15]*
If not, why have you not been saving a portion of your income on a monthly basis?

1) My income has been reduced
2) I am paying off debt and not able to save right now
3) I have a lot of expenses
4) I don’t have a goal to save towards
5) I am not interested in saving on a monthly basis
6) I do not see the need to save anything

*[5/15]*
If you have been able to save, how much have you been able to save on a monthly basis?

1) Less than R500
2) Between R500 - R1 000
3) Between R1 000 and R5 000
4) More than R5 000

*[6/15]*
If you were to lose your main source of income, how long would you be able to cover your living expenses?

1) One week or less
2) Between 1-3 months
3) Between 3-6 months
4) 6 months or longer
5) I don’t know how long I would be able to cover my living expenses

*[7/15]*
Have you been using your savings for day-to-day expenses?

1) Yes, I have been using my savings for day-to-day expenses
2) No, I have not been using my savings for day-to-day expenses
3) No, but I have used it for an emergency(ies)

*[8/15]*
Which of the following options do you pay for monthly? (Select all that apply. Example: 1,3,5)

1) Home loan or rent
2) Credit card(s)
3) Car instalments
4) Clothing accounts
5) Policies (e.g. life, education, burial or funeral)
6) Medical aid contributions
7) Short-term insurance (e.g. cell phone, car or household insurance
8) Savings for emergencies and/or for retirement (e.g. retirement annuity)
9) School or Tertiary education fees

*[9/15]*
Have you been able to meet your monthly repayments?

1) I miss my monthly payments often
2) I have only missed my monthly payments once or twice
3) I have not missed my monthly payments

*[10/15]*
Have you used your savings to make a purchase or buy into a financial product only to realise that you have been scammed?

1) Yes, I have
2) No, I have not

*[11/15]*
In the last month, have you negotiated the interest rate you pay on your debt?

1) Yes, I have
2) No, I have not

*[12/15]*
Have you been for debt rescue, debt review or debt counselling?

1) Yes, I have and I am managing my financial obligations
2) Yes, I have and it has not helped
3) No, I don't have debt or my debt is under control
4) I don't feel comfortable going for debt rescue
5) No, I have not because I don’t see the purpose of it
6) Other (please elaborate in less than 1500 characters)

*[13/15]*
How worried are you about being able to pay your debts?

1) I am always worried
2) I am sometimes worried
3) I am rarely worried
4) I am not worried

*[14/15]*
When you have experienced a financial emergency, do you think that the information you learned from the WageWise program: 

1) Helped you to cope
2) Helped you to speak to someone you trust about your financial situation
3) Helped you to speak to your employer about your financial concerns
4) Did not help you cope

*[15/15]*
When you have to make an important financial decision, how do you react (Select all the appropriate answers. Example: 2,3,4)

1) Rely on advice from a financial advisor
2) Rely on advice from family or friends
3) Rely on what you learned on the WageWise programme
4) Rely on what you read on the WageWise website
5) I don’t make important financial decisions in my household
